main_definition: When referring to an action or state, 'taken' means something has been removed, acquired, or experienced; when used as a past participle of the verb 'take', it indicates that someone has accepted or received something.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To remove or take away from its original place
meanings_and_examples.example: The gardener took the weeds out of the garden.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Something that has been acquired, received, or taken possession of
meanings_and_examples.example: I have several books that were given to me as gifts; they've been very valuable.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To experience something fully or deeply
meanings_and_examples.example: After reading the novel, she was truly taken by its powerful storytelling.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used as a past participle of 'take' to indicate acceptance or reception
meanings_and_examples.example: The team has been thoroughly taken aback by the unexpected turn of events.
